DESCRIPTION Bring the whole family for some fresh country air and the very best strawberries. We grow three varieties of summer bearing red raspberries along with black raspberries (black caps). We also have fall bearing red and yellow raspberries. We grow 23 acres of 20 different varieties of apples for pick your own and sale in our farm market Fall time at the farm includes wagon rides for the whole family to the orchard and to the pumpkin patch. From the market you can watch our famous apple cider being made in the adjacent cider mill.

DESCRIPTION Across greater Hamilton, 70 kilometres of pathways and converted rail corridors have been registered as part of the Trans Canada Trail. These include the Hamilton to Brantford Rail Trail, the Chippawa Trail, Escarpment Rail Trail and a proposed route through the city. When completed, the TCT will touch all three oceans bordering Canada and become the longest shared-use trail in the world at 16,000 kilometres. Water from these oceans will be carried by relay to the TCT fountain in Ottawa.

DESCRIPTION John C. Munro Hamilton International Airport (YHM) provides a hassle-free environment for passengers traveling in and out of Hamilton, Toronto and Southern Ontario. The airport is located just west of Toronto and is the closest airport for over 1.7 million consumers. The passenger airlines presently serving the airport is WestJet Airlines. Points served from Hamilton include: Abbotsford, Kelowna, Vancouver, Victoria, Calgary, Comox, Edmonton, Fort McMurray, Grande Prairie, Prince George, Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Winnipeg, Ottawa, Thunder Bay and Moncton. This airline continues to expand with additional routes. For up to date information consult www.westjet.com. For more information about Hamilton International Airport visit their website at www.yhm.com.

properties.name: Hamilton GO Centre
properties.description:
Attributes
TITLE Hamilton GO Centre
ADDRESS 36 Hunter Street East, Hamilton, ON
PHONE 416-869-3200
TOLL_FREE 1-888-438-6646
URL http://www.gotransit.com/
DESCRIPTION It has a history, it has passenger services, it has newspapers and coffee - and it has a time-capsule railroad museum that will captivate anyone who ever wanted to wear a conductor's hat or be an engineer. A transportation nexus for Hamilton and the region, the Hamilton GO Centre is the arrival and embarkation point for many modes of transportation, including: GO Service (train and bus) to and from Toronto and a connection to Via Rail (and thence to anywhere in the Western Hemisphere). Several Bus Lines including Greyhound, Trentway, Farr, drop off and pick up here. The station was rebuilt with a humane sensibility - it is wheelchair accessible, with special ramps for boarding, and a pickup/drop-off area for Hamilton's special DARTS transportation service. When booking your tour or trip, you may wish to keep these facility in mind.
AREA How to get here
